data.title: Nice service
data.text: We stopped here prior to attending a comedy show at Mark Ridley's.  It food was pretty good and seemed authentic.  The service was great, although a little slow.

data.title: Very nice Place
data.text: Very nice place, clean friendly. Plenty of tv viewing. big and roomy. Seem to be the place to go when soccer(football) is on. They love the Mexican team. Food was very good and plentiful. May be under staff the day we were there. Parking is in the rear but some parking out front in street if you can find it.

data.title: Outdoor dining and a deal on fajitas!
data.text: I had a pleasant dinner here with a friend. It was chicken fajita night and they were good as well as cheap. Nice outdoor dining.

data.title: Can't Dance Away The Stale Bar Smell
data.text:
NOPE.
We went there to check the place out during the day. The bar odor was so overwhelming that we WALKED IN AND WALKED OUT.  Sorry Cantina Diablos.  I would  come back if the place at least smelled clean :(  I was hopeful to make this a destination dancing place but you weren't up to "snuff "  I'm so sorry :/

data.title: 2 in a row
data.text: Well.  We used to love this place.  There is one server who came from the Ferndale location and she is wonderful.  But, unfortunate, the last 2 visits have been horrible from a service standpoint.  Admittedly we sat at the high tops in the bar area both times.  The last guy bartender was just flat out rude and this recent gal was just over worked.  Maybe they short staff on Sunday's for some reason but having put myself through college waiting tables the service is important and it's unfortunate.  We are long time residents so will likely try again but I hope this is just unfortunate luck on our end.

data.title: Good Tex Mex
data.text:
This Tex Mex restaurant is at the heart of the RO dining Mecca at 11 Mile @ Main St.  Our middle of the week experience was good- light traffic and very efficient service. 
The comp chips- salsa were good, one salsa that had a little heat, but not overpowering for my palate. 
The burritos were quite generous in size and other plates  chicken quesadilla  and enchiladas were adequate.  Prices are the standard $2-3 higher in RO than elsewhere and for RO diners, accustomed to the prices.

data.title: Vibe, Service, Food, Fun
data.text:
I LOVED the Atmosphere, especially considering that there aren't many places like this in Detroit (at least none that I've found.) I happened to stroll in with a friend on a Friday night which, SURPRISE, was Salsa Night. I could hardly believe the energy in this place. All of the patrons mingled freely with both me and other strangers and immediately I felt like I was a part of a family (as cheesy as that sounds).

The food was phenomenal. It was hot and full of flavor, which I greatly appreciated. I must recommend the fish tacos--any of the fish (buffalo shrimp!!!) and the Avocado Rolls, they were to die for. We ended up ordering and ordering again.

Service is the reason I give this restaurant 4 stars instead of 5. Although, she was nice, I don't know if she was super busy this night or something, but I feel like the service slacked and we ended up waiting a while for everything. Water, food, the bill, dessert...

data.title: Great if you enjoy spicy food!
data.text: We went here as a family.  Kids eat free on Sunday, which is a great treat.  My wife and I ordered steak fajitas.  For $17, the portion of meat was on the small side.  It is also seasoned on the spicy side.  Our waitress, Jasmine, was excellent!  She was very attentive us, especially the kids.  Our drinks were kept full and the she never allowed the chips and salsa to run out.

data.title: Great guacamole and fajitas
data.text: This was our first time in this place. We just moved to Michigan 3 months ago. We were impressed with the guacamole and fajitas. Quesadillas were fair so overall a good experience. Recommended in Royal Oak

data.title: Taco Tuesday's = good, the rest = pitiful
data.text:
Been to Cantina Diablo's about 6 times now. To me it's no surprise at all that it is no longer open at lunchtime.
Went there this evening for the "Taco Tuesday" specials and I was pleased with the Buffalo shrimp taco's, the beef cheek taco's? not so much. The flavor was there but so were the large chunks of soft fat - quite gross.

I became aware of something rather bothersome when I got my bill. My bill was exactly $8.00 and the sales tax was $0.50 Why the big deal? well as MI sales tax is 6% and I do understand that rounding happens on occasion, 6% tax on $8.00 is $0.48 therefore not likely to round up by 2 cents.
I took a photo of my bill for my record and I did bring this to their attention.

Won't be going back

data.title: Good Tex-Mex in downtown Royal Oak
data.text: We've tried several restaurants in Royal Oak, and wanted to try something different so we went to Diablo's recently. We had BBQ chicken enchiladas, pulled pork quesadillas, and guacamole. The guacamole is made fresh when you order it, and it was delicious, with chunky avocado, and fresh onions and jalapeños. The house margarita was not very strong, but it was served in a 12 ounce beer glass and only cost $6, and it was a great accompaniment to the meal. We were there on a Sunday evening, and with several football games on TVs, the atmosphere and decor seemed more sports bar than Mexican cantina, but the food and service were both very good. I'm sure we'll go back, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

data.title: Good Eats, Good dancing, great drinks
data.text: nice atmosphere, especially on salsa night....good people watching & salsa dancing.  The location is nice and safe, and the wait staff were friendly.

data.title: Good setting, interesting take on TexMex cooking
data.text: I've hit this restaurant a number of times with co-workers while on site, we've always been pleased with the drink selection and the setting (we like the booths). The menu definitely has a more interesting flair than the typical TexMex joint so if you're looking for Mexican but something at least a little different than usual it's definitely worth a try.

data.title: Came for Dinner at the wrong time, but it was fun!
data.text: My husband and I always like to try new places to eat and share our experiences with friends and family. We chose Mexican this night and it was a Friday and didn't know it was also Salsa bar/club. I had the California fish tacos and my husband had a meat platter. His dish was perfect on point and delicious. Mine on the other hand was ok. I would of liked to have had a little more seasoning on it but it was still good. Just not great. With that being said it was too loud to hear our conversation with one another BUT I got to dance it off and enjoyed the margaritas. The server was on the greener side of servicing but he did good for being new. I would recommend coming here just a little earlier if you want to enjoy your dinner then take advantage of the dancing!!

data.title: Salsa!!!
data.text: Good Mexican food but the salsa music (Friday night) and atmosphere of dancing and Latin vibe is great fun.

data.title: Good food, So so service
data.text:
Our school had an end of the year get together at Cantina Diablos in June.  We were seated at three very long tables, which made it hard to interact with many people.  You had to get up and walk around to talk to different people.  The food I had was tacos.  It was Taco Tuesday, so they were cheap. I had beef tacos, they were spicy, but delicious.
The service was not so good.  It took a long time for everyone to get there orders.
I would return to Cantina again, but perhaps on a date.

data.title: Terrible Service - Managed Horribly - Good Tacos
data.text:
We went on a Tuesday to try their 2$ taco Tuesday. The place was fairly full but they were able to seat us right away. As we were led to our table she saw it hadn't been wiped down yet. After standing there for a bit we were able to finally sit.  It took forever for the waiter to come so I had to track down the manager to order drinks. Then waited forever to get them. After my wife arrived to meet us she ordered a Margarita on the rocks. 15 min went by, had to get up again, find the waiter and ask where the drink was. He eventually came back with the wrong flavor and it was frozen not on the rocks.  We ordered 4 tacos and a bean burrito. Waited 35 min without seeing our waiter for refills or food. Had to get up again and find our waiter. 10 more minutes went by and finally got our food.  The tacos were very good- the only reason I gave this 2 stars.  All together our experience took 1 1/2 hours. As we were leaving it looked like lots of people all over the restaurant were waiting on food. 

Even though the tacos were good and had lots of TVs for games I cannot go back here. The service really needs an overhaul.

data.title: Should be called Old salted meat
data.text: We gave this place a second chance.  We were served taco chips loaded with salt, you can see the salt on them.  Food was full of salt....you can see chunks of salt on everything, meat was old.  Taco Bell would of been 100% better.  Maybe if your drunk you will not notice the poor quality but for me and my family...second and last time

data.title: not handicap friendly
data.text: Food was good. No tables are for handicapped. They sat us at a small table at the back that wasn't part of the customer seating area by ourselves. Not ADA complaint?

data.title: Poor service, average atmosphere, good food
data.text: We visited three times. One  time with family, one time with friends and the most recent visit as a couple, because family and friends didn't want to come back here. It's always very loud. You can hear some kind of very loud music coming out of somewhere, so it's impossible to watch a game or have a conversation. Service has been horrible the first two times and okay during the most recent visit (went as a couple) The hostess, waitress, bartender... someone was always almost topless, one waitress did not give us exact change, drinks were not refilled, some items ordered were missing, ladies were addressed as "hun" by James, "the manager", just to name a few problems. Yes, this place serves a very good Mexican food, but it takes a little more to have a nice dining experience than just to get stuffed. If you decide to go, they open at 4PM few days a week, Mon-Thu, I think, and all day on weekends.
